citation.article-title: Taxonomic study of Bacteroides oralis and related organisms and proposal of Bacteroides veroralis sp. nov.

p.s: Description of Bacteroides veroralis sp. nov.
Bacteroides veroralis (ver'o.ral.is. L. adj. verus true; L. adj. oralis pertaining to the mouth; N.L. masc. adj. veroralis the true oralis).
Cell characteristics.
Obligately anaerobic, nonmotile, nonsporeforming , gram-negative, rod-shaped cells 0.5 μm wide by 1.0 to 1.5 μm long.
Gram strains of pure cultures show predominantly short rod-shaped cells in pairs or short chains of long rod-shaped cells.
Colonies.
After incubation for 2 days on EG agar, colonies were 1.0 to 2.0 mm in diameter, circular, entire, convex, translucent, smooth, and shiny.
Cultural characteristics.
Cultures in prereduced peptone yeast extract broth were moderately turbid, sometimes with a slight, smooth sediment.
Growth was enhanced in broth supplemented with a fermentable carbohydrate.
The optimal temperature for growth was about 37°C.
After good growth was observed in peptone-yeast extract-glucose medium cultures, the pH was 4.7.
The pH of cultures in broth media without fermentable carbohydrate was usually 6.1.
Biochemical characteristics.
Some biochemical reactions of this species are shown in Table 1.
Nitrate was not reduced.
Neither indole nor hydrogen sulfide was produced.
Bile did not stimulate growth.
Little or no gas was formed from glucose.
Acid and clots were produced in milk.
Lecithinase was not produced in egg yolk agar.
Source.
This organism was isolated from a human oral cavity.
G+C content.
The G+C content of the DNA was 42.1 mol%.
Type strain.
The type strain is VPI D22A-7T (= ATCC 33779T).
